Hubby is from the very county where these icons of Western films got accidentally introduced.
The story: It was the 19th century and Hutterite (like Mennonite or Amish) farmers in Bon Homme County, South Dakota sent off a payment to Russia for some grain The grain was sent back and they planted. The grain grew strong but so did some unintended weeds called Russian thistle. These broke off and blew off in the prairie wind, scattering their seeds everywhere. It didn't take long for them to colonize the plains, the semideserts, everywhere that was open land that had dry spells.
